sentence: How do you find a blind man on a nude beach? it aint hard....
explanation: In this context, hard refers to something being difficult.
first_new_sentence: Solving this math problem is quite hard for many students.
second_new_sentence: The rock was hard and unyielding to my touch.

sentence: Why couldnt the troll catch any fish? because other people took the bait.
explanation: In this context, bait refers to food used to attract fish.
first_new_sentence: The fisherman used worms as bait to catch more fish.
second_new_sentence: The offer was merely bait to entice customers into the store.

sentence: Why couldnt the nsa whistleblower leave moscow? he got snowed in.
explanation: In this context, snowed refers to being covered in snow.
first_new_sentence: The heavy snowfall meant many people were snowed in at home.
second_new_sentence: The kids were snowed under with all their homework this weekend.

sentence: What did the ear of corn say when all of its clothes fell off? aww, shucks!
explanation: In this context, shucks is an expression of disappointment.
first_new_sentence: He carefully shucks the corn before boiling it.
second_new_sentence: The shucks of corn were scattered everywhere after the harvest.

sentence: This format provides each joke along with a single word that can be interpreted in dual contexts, and two serious sentences demonstrating those meanings.
